    StrAPI.All
    StrAPI.AlwaysValid
    StrAPI.ByteCompare
    StrAPI.CharSetASCIICompat — Type.

    Characters 0-0x7f same as ASCII

    StrAPI.CharSetBMP — Type.

    Characters 0-0xd7ff, 0xe000-0xffff follow Unicode BMP

    StrAPI.CharSetBinary — Type.

    8-bit Binary string, not text

    StrAPI.CharSetISOCompat — Type.

    Characters 0-0x9f follows ISO 8859

    StrAPI.CharSetOther — Type.

    Codepoints are not in Unicode compatible order

    StrAPI.CharSetStyle — Type.
    CharSetStyle(A)
CharSetStyle(typeof(A))

    CharSetStyle specifies the information about the character set used by the string or characters. When you define a new AbstractString or AbstractChar type, you can choose to implement it with

    StrAPI.CharSetStyle(::Type{<:MyString}) = StrAPI.CharSetISOCompat()

    The default is CharSetUnicode()

    StrAPI.CharSetUnicode — Type.

    Full Unicode character set, no additions

    StrAPI.CharSetUnicodePlus — Type.

    Unicode character set, plus encodings of invalid characters

    StrAPI.CharSetUnknown — Type.

    Raw bytes, words, or character string, unknown encoding/character set

    StrAPI.CodePointCompare
    StrAPI.CodePoints
    StrAPI.CodeUnitTypes
    StrAPI.CompareStyle — Type.
    CompareStyle(Union{A, typeof(A)}, Union{B, typeof(B)})

    CompareStyle specifies how to compare two strings with character set encodings A and B

    StrAPI.CompareStyle(::Type{<:MyString}, ::Type{String}) = StrAPI.ByteCompare()

    The default is CodePointCompare

    StrAPI.Direction
    StrAPI.Each
    StrAPI.EncodingStyle — Type.
    EncodingStyle(A)
EncodingStyle(typeof(A))

    EncodingStyle specifies the whether a character set encoding uses one or multiple codeunits to encode a single codepoint. When you define a new AbstractString type, you can choose to implement it with either single or multi-codeunit indexing.

    StrAPI.EncodingStyle(::Type{MyCharSetEncoding}) = StrAPI.MultiCodeUnitEncoding()

    The default is SingleCodeUnitEncoding()

    StrAPI.Unicode
    StrAPI.UnknownValidity
    StrAPI.ValidatedStyle — Type.
    ValidatedStyle(A)
ValidatedStyle(typeof(A))

    ValidatedStyle specifies the whether a string or character type is always valid or not When you define a new AbstractString or AbstractChar type, you can choose to implement it as always validated, or validation state unknown.

    StrAPI.ValidatedStyle(::Type{<:MyCharType}) = StrAPI.AlwaysValid()

    The default is UnknownValidity

    StrAPI.codepoint_error
    StrAPI.codepoints — Function.
    codepoints(str)

    An iterator that generates the code points of a string

    Examples

    julia> a = str("abc🖖")

julia> collect(a)

julia> collect(codepoints(a))
